unlabeled: streaks or trails of light from vehicles or streetlights
blurred or motion-blurred objects due to camera movement
reflections or glare from headlights or taillights
faint outlines of buildings, trees, or other objects
stars or moon visible in the sky
road: marked by lines, lanes, or edges
often lined with curb, gutter, or sidewalk
may have traffic markings or signs
can be light or dark in color depending on material and lighting
may have patterns or textures from asphalt, concrete, or other materials
sidewalk: a paved path beside a road
usually made of concrete or asphalt
often has a distinct edge or curb
may have markings or patterns such as lines, cracks, or textures
may be lined with obstacles like trash cans, signs, or benches
people may be walking or standing on it
building: large structure with walls and a roof
windows, doors, and other architectural features
exterior materials such as brick, concrete, glass, or metal
lighting, such as interior lights or outdoor illumination
wall: made of materials such as brick, concrete, wood, or metal
can be freestanding or part of a building
may have windows, doors, or other features
can be textured, patterned, or painted
casts a shadow, especially at night
fence: a barrier or enclosure made of wood, metal, or other materials
vertical or horizontal parallel bars or wires
posts or pillars that support the bars or wires
a consistent pattern or design throughout the fence
a clear boundary or separation from the surrounding environment
pole: typically uniform in color and texture
often with a rounded or tapered top
may have a base or anchor at the bottom
can be made of various materials such as wood, metal, or concrete
may have attachments or fixtures such as lights, signs, or wires
traffic light: three colored lenses (red, yellow, green) or arrows
black or dark-colored frame or housing
mounted above the road or at an intersection
wired or wireless connections to a control box or power source
traffic sign: mounted on a pole or hung from a gantry
bright colors such as yellow, orange, red, green, or blue
reflective surface to increase visibility at night
text or symbols conveying traffic information or instructions
a distinct border or frame around the sign face
often mounted near roads or intersections
vegetation: Texture or pattern of leaves, stems, or flowers
Shadows or lighting patterns that indicate non-rigid structure
Clustering or grouping of similar shapes
terrain: natural landscape features such as hills, mountains, valleys, or plains
natural elements like rocks, soil, sand, or water
vegetation such as trees, grass, or bushes
terrain features like cliffs, caves, or canyons
sky: occupies the top portion of the image
typically blue or dark blue during the day
black or dark at night with stars or moon visible
may have clouds, sun, moon, or stars
gradation of color from horizon to top of image
often meets the horizon line where it meets the land or sea
bus: distinctive paint or design on the side or front
bicycle: a frame with a horizontal top tube, seat post, and handlebars
chain or belt connecting the pedals to the rear wheel
seat and handlebars for the rider
possible presence of gears, brakes, and suspension components
may have reflectors, lights, or other safety features
